result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel W Pam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered defendant to pay DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Court waived all other court costs, fees and surcharges due to finding of indigency. If revoked, court ordered that DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Cognitive Thinking Course.
Write a 5-page letter of reflection or goals.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel W Pam

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel W Pam in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Nathaniel W Pam in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by: Stacy G. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 139 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Work on obtaining HSD/GED/HSED.
- Complete 120 hours of community service.  
- Cognitive Thinking Course.
- Write a 5-page letter of reflection or goals.

Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge during the term of extended supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Court waived all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to a finding of indigency.  If revoked, Court ordered that DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Nathaniel W Pam not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requested a Plea and Sentencing hearing. Court set date as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Nathaniel W Pam not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defense requested a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Nathaniel W Pam not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing.  Case was passed then recalled with same appearances. State did not comply with victim notification. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Nathaniel W Pam in court by video with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw who appears in person.  Defendant Nathaniel W Pam in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with SMG
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nathaniel W Pam in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Nathaniel W Pam in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel W Pam appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
